html:
LONDON, December 14 (IFR)

  • Gore Street Energy Storage raises £60m 
  • Nanobiotix on track for maximum proceeds target

Pirelli is in the market tonight with an offer of €500m zero-coupon convertible bonds due 2025. The paper is offered at 100%–102.5%, to be redeemed at par, for a yield to maturity of negative 0.49% to 0%. The premium is 40%–45% above the reference price to be set in a delta placing anticipated at up to €75m. Proceeds will be used to refinance debt and for general corporate purposes. Credit Suisse and Goldman Sachs are global coordinators, and bookrunners with Banca IMI,BNP Paribas, CICC, Mizuho International and UniCredit.  Books were covered within 45 minutes through the mid-point on the CB and covered on the delta placing.

JP Morgan is bookrunner tonight on an institutional sell-down in Airtel Africa, with 60m shares representing 1.6% of share capital. The trade launched with guidance of 80p–84p, an 8.9%–13% discount to the 92.2p close, for a deal size of £48m–£50m.

Gore Street Energy Storage Fund has raised £60m through a placing, offer for subscription and intermediaries offer run by JP Morgan and Shore Capital. 

Gore Street said there was a significant level of demand exceeding target proceeds of £60m, leading to scaling back of orders.

Proceeds will be used to acquire new projects and finance capital expenditure for projects totalling around 1.3GW.

A total of 60m new shares were sold at 100p each, representing a 7.8% discount to the November 27 close of 108.5p, and a 4% premium to the last reported NAV of 96.2p on June 30. Shares in Gore Street fell on Monday, closing 3.3% down at 103p. 

Gore Street last raised cash from investors in August 2019 through a £30.9m placing and offer for subscription.

Nanobiotix will wrap up the European leg of its fundraising on Tuesday, a placing that follows the French nanomedicine company's listing on Nasdaq on Friday.

The cancer-focused company is offering 1.855m shares in the European offering at €11.14 per share, the euro equivalent to the US$13.50 per share paid for the 4.445m ADS (equivalent to one share each). In aggregate the two legs should raise €81.3m to fund a Phase III trial in the US of its Hensify cancer treatment, which has been approved in Europe.

The company said that this fundraising and existing cash will be sufficient to fund operations until the first quarter of 2023.

The European offering, which ran alongside the US leg, should be a breeze as shares have leapt on the back of the successful US listing. Shares gained 9.1% on Friday to €13.60 and were trading steadily over €14 all morning and into the late afternoon but faded towards the close and ended down for the day at €13.42. Nanobiotix had closed on debut in New York on Friday at US$16.98, up nearly 26%.

Jefferies is global coordinator, and bookrunner with Evercore and UBS on the US offer, while Jefferies is bookrunner on the global offering alongside Gilbert Dupont as manager.

This week’s deals

Monday

Granges (Sweden – Aluminium): SKr1.7bn (US$198m) rights issue, 28.34m new on 4-for-11 basis at SKr60 (32.2% discount to TERP), 66.4% shareholder commitments, balance underwritten, subscription November 27-December 11, rights trading finishes December 8. Danske Bank, Nordea, Svenska Handelsbanken

Gore Street Energy Storage Fund (UK): £60m initial placing, offer for subscription and intermediaries offer, 60m new shares at 100p (7.8% to the November 27 close of 108.5p, and a 3.6 % premium to the last reported NAV of 96.2p), books November 30-December 11 for placing, offer for subscription and intermediaries offer, result December 14. JP Morgan, Shore Capital

N Brown (UK – Online clothing retailer): £100m placing and open offer, 174.66m in conditional placing, offered in 11-for-18 open offer November 6-December 14, result December 15, EGM November 23. Jefferies (Rothschild advising)

Scandinavian Biogas Fuels (Sweden): SKr532.4m (US$63m) Premier Growth Market Stockholm IPO, 9.33m primary and 4.8m secondary at fixed SKr37.50, 1.4m 10% secondary greenshoe, 46.5%-51.1% free-float, books December 8-14, allocations December 15, trading December 16. ABG Sundal Collier

Pirelli (Italy – Tyres): €500m 2025 CB offered 100%-102.5% and redeemed 100%, 0% coupon, negative 0.49% to 0% YTM, 40%-45% premium over delta placing. Credit Suisse, Goldman Sachs, BNP Paribas, CICC, ING, Intesa Sanpaolo, Mizuho International, UniCredit

Tuesday

Round Hill Music Royalty Fund: Placing at US$1.01. Closes 3pm December 15, result December 16. Cenkos

Wednesday

Schroder BCS Social (UK – Fund): £100m IPO via placing, offer for subscription and intermediaries offer, 100m at 100p, intermediaries/offer for subscription November 23-December 15, placing closes December 16, result December 17, trading December 22. Winterflood Securities

Pipeline 

PENDING - JP Morgan Global Core Real Assets (UK)

£80m-plus placing, offer for subscription and intermediaries offer at 100p, closes December 9, result December 10. JP Morgan

PENDING - Ecofin US Renewables Infrastructure Trust (UK)

US$250m LSE IPO, 250m at US$1, closes December 9, result December 10, trading December 14. Stifel

December – Agyapa Royalties (Ghana – Gold)

US$400m-$500m IPO, LSE and Ghanaian Stock Exchange. Bank of America, JP Morgan

January 2021 - InDex Pharmaceuticals (Sweden)

SKr500m rights issue, January EGM, terms to follow. Barclays, Carnegie

January 2021 - Swiss Steel

€200m-equivalent rights issue, December 22 EGM, guaranteed by main shareholder

February 2021 – VH Global Sustainable Energy Opportunities (UK)

£400m London IPO, prospectus early January, completion February. Numis

March 2021 – ITAB Shop Concept (Sweden – Retail solutions)

SKr768m (US$91m) rights issue, 102.38m on 1-for-1 basis at SKr7.50 (24% discount to SKr9.91 TERP), 94% guaranteed, EGM January 15, subscription mid-February. Macquarie Capital, Nordea

H1 2021  –  Sasol (South Africa - Chemicals)

US$2bn rights issue. Bank of America, Citigroup, JP Morgan

2021  – Vallourec (France – Steel tubes)

€800m fully underwritten capital increase, approval at EGM April 6. BNP Paribas, Morgan Stanley, Natixis, Societe Generale

2021   – Keliber (Finland – Lithium mining)

Helsinki IPO. Carnegie, Nordea

2021– Giochi Preziosi (Italy – Toys)

IPO. Banca Akros, Banca IMI, Barclays, Jefferies, Santander (Rothschild advising)
